intro: Ranunculus laetevirens, commonly known as the cheerful green buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to Central Asia. It features delicate, palmately divided leaves and bright yellow flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It blooms in early spring, often before the leaves fully develop. This species is valued in gardens for its ornamental beauty and is relatively easy to cultivate.
